children.name: orchestra
children.definition: a large group of musicians who play many different instruments together and are led by a conductor : dàn nhạc
examples: the Berlin Symphony Orchestra
the school orchestra
in a orchestra
She's a cellist in the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra.

children.name: band
children.definition: a group of musicians andvocalistswho play modern music together : ban nhạc; đội nhạc; dàn nhạc
examples: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
The Beatles are probably the most famous band in the world.
form a bandThey formed their own band and released a single.
join a bandHe took up the saxophone and joined the school band.
play/sing in a band(= be a musician or singer in a band )Budd played in a rock band.
lead a band(= either as lead singer or as a conductor )He led his own band in Florida and played in clubs.
a band performs/playsThe band is performing live on Saturday night.
a band strikes up(= starts playing )We were on the dance floor waiting for the band to strike up.
a rock/jazz etc bandHe's the saxophonist in a jazz band.
a brass band(= a band of brass instruments such as trumpets and trombones )A brass band was playing in the park.
a live band(= playing live music, not recorded music )There's a live band at the club on Saturday nights.
the school bandShe plays the trumpet in the school band.
a marching band(= musicians who march as they play )the Ohio state marching band
a military band(= musicians who play music on military occasions )a military band with their brass and their drums
boy/girl banda group of fashionable young men or women who perform popular songs together and dance as a group
He made his name in the nineties boy band Boyzone, before going on to a highly successful solo career.
a band memberHe was one of the original band members.
a band leader(= the conductor of a brass band, a military band, etc )
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'make a band'. Sayform a band.

children.name: group
children.definition: a number of musicians or singers who perform together, playing popular music: ban nhạc
examples: What's your favourite group?
a pop/rock/jazz groupThey’re one of the most exciting pop groups around at the moment.
a member of a groupJeremy was a member of a heavy metal group.
be in a groupShe's in a jazz group, playing the saxophone.
start a groupBen and some friends started a rock group at school.
found a groupformal(= start a group )Mick Jagger and Keith Richards founded the group in the early Sixties.
a group splits up(= the members decide not to play together anymore )The group split up because of ‘musical differences’.
a group re-forms(= the members decide to play together again )The group has re-formed and is planning a series of comeback concerts.

children.name: player
children.definition: a person who plays a musical instrument người chơi một nhạc cụ nào đó
examples: a recorder/ guitar/ piano player.

children.name: accompanist
children.definition: sb who plays a musical instrument while another person sings or plays the main tune
examples: Rieger prefers being an accompanist to being a concert pianist.
He is better known as an accompanist than as a composer.
accompanist on
The singer's accompanistonthe piano was Charles Harman.

children.name: instrumentalist
children.definition: sb who plays a musical instrument, especially as a job (rather thanvocalist) nhạc công
examples: He was one of the finest instrumentalists of his day.

children.name: street musician
children.definition: /buskerUK  sb who plays music in a public place such as a street or railway station, so that people will give them money:người hát rong, nghệ sĩ đường phố
examples: A street musician sat on the other side of the courtyard, banging a drum.
In the summer, buskers fill the town’s streets and public squares.

children.name: musician
children.definition: sb who plays a musical instrument, especially as a profession, or is musically talented : nhạc sĩ
examples: a talented young musician
your father was a fine musician
aspiring rock and pop musicians

children.name: soloist
children.definition: sb who plays or sings the main part of a piece of music alone, or with a musical group supporting them:nghệ sĩ độc tấu
examples: There will be four soloists in tonight’s performance.
Violin soloist Jessica Solano will perform Mozart’s Concerto No. 4.
cello soloist Yo Yo Ma

children.name: songwriter
children.definition: someone who writes the words and usually the music of songs, especially modern, popular songs:người viết nhạc
examples: Most of Elton John’s early hits were written by songwriter Bernie Taupin.
Music on the show is performed by singer-songwriter Vonda Shepard.
songwriter Bernie Taupin
singer-songwritersb who writes and performs their own songsnhạc sĩ kiêm ca sĩ
Kaylie is a very talented singer-songwriter.

children.name: lyricist
children.definition: sb who writes words for songs, especially pop songs : người viết lời bài hát

children.name: composer
children.definition: sb who writes music, especially classical music: nhà soạn nhạc
examples: Henry Purcell was one of the greatest English composers.
Amelia likes German composers, particularly Wagner.
My favourite composer is Beethoven.
the composer Philip Glass.

children.name: musical
children.definition: good at or interested in playing or singing music : có năng khiếu về nhạc
examples: The family all play instruments - they're all very musical.
She’s very musical and loves to sing.

children.name: conductor
children.definition: sb who stands in front of a group of musicians or singers and directs their playing or singing : chỉ huy
examples: The conductor raised his baton.
a guest conductor

children.name: leader
children.definition: UKconcertmasterUS  the most important violin player in an orchestra.
examples: In conductor-led orchestras, the concertmaster is usually more of a team captain.

children.name: pianist
children.definition: sb who plays the piano : nghệ sĩ dương cầm
examples: a concert pianist
a jazz pianist

children.name: organist
children.definition: a person who plays an organ, especially in a church or as a job : người đánh đàn ống
examples: a church organist

children.name: keyboardist
children.definition: sb who plays an electronic keyboard.
examples: a singer and keyboardist for the band

children.name: cellist
children.definition: sb who play a cello: người chơi đàn vi-ô-lông-xen

children.name: guitarist
children.definition: sb who plays the guitar : người chơi đàn ghi-ta
examples: a classical/ folk/ rock guitarist

children.name: saxophonist
children.definition: sb who plays the saxophone

children.name: piper
children.definition: sb who plays a pipe or the bagpipes : người thổi sáo/ kèn túi
examples: We could hear a lone piper player playing in the distance.

children.name: flautist
children.definition: UK/flutistUS sb who plays the flute

children.name: drummer
children.definition: sb who plays a drum or a set of drums, especially in a music group : tay trống

children.name: percussionist
children.definition: a person who plays percussion instruments

children.name: trumpeter
children.definition: sb who plays a trumpet
examples: a jazz trumpeter

children.name: trombonist
children.definition: sb who plays the trombone: người thổi kèn trôm-bon
examples: My cousin is ajazztrombonist.
a trombonist read a newspaper spread across his music stand
